docs.snippet: Week Ended June 20, 1947 A number of significant fluctuations in the foreign exchanges made last week's market interesting because of the cross-currents which developed. The acute weakness of sterling "forwards" was one case in point, shared by a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended June 20, 1947 A number of significant fluctuations in the foreign exchanges made last week's market interesting because of the cross-currents which developed. The acute weakness of sterling "forwards" was one case in point, shared by a setback in the Canadian free dollar, while the Swiss free franc reversed the trend of the last fortnight and staged a brisk advance.

docs.snippet: About two-thirds of the number of collections paid by Latin-American countries through twelve reporting New York City banks in May were "prompt," according to a monthly survey just inaugurated by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 24 (AP) -- L.A. Wheeler, chairman of the International Wheat Council, said today, a long-term international agreement to stabilize prices and supplies of wheat in world markets would not be put into effect for at least a year.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 24 (AP) -- L.A. Wheeler, chairman of the International Wheat Council, said today, a long-term international agreement to stabilize prices and supplies of wheat in world markets would not be put into effect for at least a year.

headline.main: U.S. Delays International Wheat Agreement; No Action Seen Possible for at Least a Year

docs.snippet: Today we deal with the subject of cooking with wine. It's an interesting topic any time, but it becomes actually absorbing when it's treated the way Mrs. Jeanne Owen has written about it in "The Lejon Cook Book."

docs.snippet: JERUSALEM, June 27 -- An obscure man who advocates the union of Palestine and Trans-Jordan under King Abdullah will receive an oral hearing by the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine. His name, J.W. Abileah, was among those of nine...
docs.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, June 27 -- An obscure man who advocates the union of Palestine and Trans-Jordan under King Abdullah will receive an oral hearing by the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine. His name, J.W. Abileah, was among those of nine organizations and individuals whom the committee decided today that it could hear.
docs.abstract: To testify for UN Palestine inquiry com

headline.main: U.N. GROUP TO HEAR NINE IN PALESTINE; Obscure Backer of Union With Trans-Jordan on List -- Visit Paid to University, Hospital

docs.snippet: The award of two $1,750 scholarships for study leading to the degrees of Master of Science in Naval Architecture and Master of Science in Maritime Engineering was announced yesterday by the Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The award of two $1,750 scholarships for study leading to the degrees of Master of Science in Naval Architecture and Master of Science in Maritime Engineering was announced yesterday by the Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers.

headline.main: EVENTS OF INTEREST IN SHIPPING WORLD; 2 Scholarships Are Awarded by Society for Study in Naval Architecture
